title: Nonpolar gas closer to ideal behavior

content.question: Which of the following best helps explain why the pressure of a sample of <math alttext="C H 4 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> (molar mass <math alttext="16 grams per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>16</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) is closer to the pressure predicted by the ideal gas law than a sample of <math alttext="N H 3 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> (molar mass <math alttext="17 grams per mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>17</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) ?

choices.label: <math alttext="N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules are polar while <math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules are not, and the greater attractions between <math alttext="N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules cause the molecules to collide with the walls of the container with less force.

<math alttext="N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules have a greater molar mass than <math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules, so the <math alttext="N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules collide with the walls of the container with more force.

<math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules have more hydrogen atoms than <math alttext="N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules, so <math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules have more hydrogen bonding and greater intermolecular forces.

<math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules are larger than <math alttext="N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules, so the actual <math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules take up a significant portion of the volume of the gas.

content.answer: <math alttext="N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules are polar while <math alttext="C H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules are not, and the greater attractions between <math alttext="N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules cause the molecules to collide with the walls of the container with less force.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
